parts.text: whats new in the project today?
I'll check what's new in the project today. Since you didn't specify a project name, I'll assume you mean the "v2" project and look for changes from today.

input.sql:
SELECT * FROM field_changes 
WHERE project_name = $1 
AND changed_at >= CURRENT_DATE 
ORDER BY changed_at DESC

rows.new_value: I’m noticing that when I create a new task, it doesn’t appear in the task list. My guess is that the workspace isn’t reporting an agent status. This might be resolved by using the experimental Tasks API. **Task created** **Task not being displayed**

rows.old_value:
To supply the information needed for the CLI command we need to add an API endpoint to supply the data.

Endpoint should be added to coderd (should check for experiment & entitlement).

Acceptance criteria:
- bulk retrieval endpoint supporting paging with filtering (just session for now)
- ONLY administrators should be able to query this endpoint
rows.new_value:
To supply the information needed for the CLI command we need to add an API endpoint to supply the data.

Endpoint should be added to coderd (should check for experiment & entitlement).

Acceptance criteria:
- bulk retrieval endpoint supporting paging with filtering (just interception for now)
- ONLY administrators should be able to query this endpoint

dbpurge: purge expired api keys
dbpurge: purge expired api keys
dbpurge: purge expired api keys
rows.new_value:
Relates to:
- https://github.com/coder/coder/pull/19725/
- https://github.com/coder/coder/pull/19667/
- https://github.com/coder/jetbrains-coder/pull/568

#19725 added an index to reduce the impact of large numbers of API keys on the UI.

#19667 adds logic to dbpurge to expire API keys belonging to the prebuilds user

jetbrains-coder#568 fixed an issue with the JetBrains plugin that caused large numbers of API keys to be created.

As a separate follow-up to this, add logic to `dbpurge` to delete expired API keys created by the JetBrains plugin to reduce the size of the database.

rows.content_title: UI: Unable to select nested devcontainer
UI: Unable to select nested devcontainer
rows.new_value: UI: Unable to select nested devcontainer

rows.content_title: UI: Unable to select nested devcontainer
rows.new_value:
I'm experimenting with the relatively new "native" devcontainer support in Coder. I my situation, I create an "outer" or "main" pod via a kubernetes deployment - that "main" pod will contain one or more "child" devcontainers. However the coder plugin for Gateway will not let me select and connect to the "child" pods. The plugin correctly authenticates to my deployment and shows all pods - but when selecting a "child" pod, the focus will always reset to the "main" pod. I will attach a screen recording showing the behavior. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6488713a-d4d2-4584-9122-b36d1296120a My environment: JetBrains Gateway 2025.2.1 Build #GW-252.25557.133, built on August 27, 2025 Source revision: ee1e6cb62e111 Runtime version: 21.0.8+9-b1038.68 aarch64 VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o. Toolkit: sun.lwawt.macosx.LWCToolkit macOS 14.7.8 This IDE is managed by Guidewire Software via JetBrains IDE Services.
JetBrains IDE Services version: 2025.4.0.2089-ij251, https://gwre-ijlicvault.jetbrains-ide-services.com GC: G1 Young Generation, G1 Concurrent GC, G1 Old Generation Memory: 2048M Cores: 11 Metal Rendering is ON Registry: ide.experimental.ui=true jetbrains.tbe.auth.use.require.new.token=emergency-only Non-Bundled Plugins: com.coder.gateway (2.22.1) org.jetbrains.toolbox-enterprise-client (2025.4.0.2089-ij251)

rows.content_title: bug: GetDeploymentWorkspaceAgentStats creates lots of DB load with many workspaces
rows.new_value: Over a three hour connection scaletest, with 6k workspaces, this query generated the most load on the DB in terms of total time, and by CPU utilization - according to CloudSQL query insights. Times called: 3460 Avg execution time (ms): 674.66 P95 execution timing (seconds): (Each of the four 'blocks' of spikes on the graph correlates with workspace traffic being simulated. i.e. when clients are connected to agents) CloudSQL Query Insights:

rows.content_title: bug: {"message":"Failed to dial peer.","detail":"context deadline exceeded"}
rows.new_value:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

I used wsl + dockerdesktop.

i used the following:

export CODER_DATA=$HOME/.config/coderv2-docker
export DOCKER_GROUP=$(getent group docker | cut -d: -f3)
mkdir -p $CODER_DATA
docker run --rm -it \
  -v $CODER_DATA:/home/coder/.config \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  --group-add $DOCKER_GROUP \
  ghcr.io/coder/coder:latest

I got {"message":"Failed to dial peer.","detail":"context deadline exceeded"}

### Relevant Log Output

```shell
Coder v2.26.0+a056cb6 - Your Self-Hosted Remote Development Platform
Started HTTP listener at http://127.0.0.1:3000
Using built-in PostgreSQL (/home/coder/.config/coderv2/postgres)
Opening tunnel so workspaces can connect to your deployment. For production scenarios, specify an external access URL
╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║               View the Web UI:                ║
║   https://htlb4lhrog1jq.pit-1.try.coder.app   ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════╝

==> Logs will stream in below (press ctrl+c to gracefully exit):
2025-09-19 02:41:34.929 [info]  notifications.manager.notifier: started  notifier_id=b9febc43-0123-494a-906e-e484c10fc059
2025-09-19 02:41:34.933 [info]  notifications.report_generator: report generator finished  duration=3.621561ms
```

### Expected Behavior

I want to see the UI.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. prepare dockerdesktop with wsl2(ubuntu)
2. run the official command

### Environment

- Host OS: win11+wsl2(ubuntu)+dockerdesktop
- Coder version: see above


### Additional Context

_No response_

parts.text:
Based on the data from today, here's what's new in the v2 project:

## Key Status Changes

**Completed Items:**
- **Issue #1004** (coder/internal) - "Add `shared_with_group:` and `shared_with_user:` filters to /workspaces endpoint"
  - Status: "In Review" → "Done" (changed_at: 2025-09-19T20:15:23Z)
  - State: OPEN → CLOSED

- **Issue #19739** (coder/coder) - "Add warning message to tasks UI"
  - Status: "In Progress" → "Done" (changed_at: 2025-09-19T17:36:07Z)
  - State: OPEN → CLOSED
  - PR #19780 was merged

- **Issue #946** (coder/internal) - "flake: TestServer/CanListenUnspecifiedv4"
  - Status: "In Review" → "Done" (changed_at: 2025-09-19T12:20:57Z)
  - State: OPEN → CLOSED

## New Issues Added
- **Issue #19894** - "Tasks: Task doesn't appear in the task list" (coder/coder)
  - Status: "📚 Backlog" 
  - Added label: "project/tasks"

- **Issue #19893** - "Tasks: Status isn't being updated correctly" (coder/coder) 
  - Status: "📚 Backlog"
  - Added label: "project/tasks"

- **Issue #19889** - "dbpurge: purge expired api keys" (coder/coder)
  - Status: "📚 Backlog"

- **Issue #1009** (coder/internal) - "bug: GetDeploymentWorkspaceAgentStats creates lots of DB load with many workspaces"
  - Status: "📚 Backlog"

## Status Progressions
- **Issue #985** (coder/internal) - "Refactor Create workspaces subcommand to split User and Workspace creation"
  - Status: "📚 Backlog" → "In Progress" → "In Review"

- **Issue #776** (coder/internal) - "MCP: Add `coder_*_task` tools"
  - Status: "To Do" → "In Progress"
  - Assigned to: code-asher

- **Issue #912** (coder/internal) - "Create load generator for Dynamic Parameters"
  - Status: "📚 Backlog" → "In Progress"
  - Assigned to: spikecurtis

## New Assignments
- **Issue #19782** (coder/coder) - "feat: prompt User to add missing `var` in CLI"
  - Assigned to: rafrdz

- **Issue #19675** (coder/coder) - "Improve task creation UX: avoid auto-redirect to encourage background agent workflow"
  - Assigned to: BrunoQuaresma

- **Issue #574** (coder/jetbrains-coder) - "UI: Unable to select nested devcontainer"
  - Assigned to: fioan89

## Pull Request Updates
- PR #19775 for OAuth token revocation was merged (2025-09-19T14:27:02Z)
- PR #19780 for tasks UI warnings was merged (2025-09-19T13:49:34Z)
- New PR #19884 opened for template dormancy hour/day toggle
- New PR #136 opened for log processing retry mechanism

Today has been particularly active with task-related issues and several completions across the coder ecosystem!
